title: Authors and Citation
text: Christophe Metsu. Maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Metsu C (2024). TheRmalUAV: Clean correct thermal UAV data. R package version 0.1.0, https://christophemetsu.github.io/Test_24052024/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {TheRmalUAV: Clean and correct thermal UAV data},   author = {Christophe Metsu},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://christophemetsu.github.io/Test_24052024/}, }

what: Clean and correct thermal UAV data
title: Clean and correct thermal UAV data
text: goal theRmalUAV clean correct raw thermal UAV data.

title: Clean and correct thermal UAV data
text: theRmalUAV CRAN (yet). can install development version theRmalUAV GitHub: Note: Windows users need RTools build packages source files (basically install GitHub). RTools R package, rather set utilities install separately. can download install RTools https://cran.r-project.org/bin/windows/Rtools/. Alternately, can install RTools within R running: RTools installed, can install theRmalUAV GitHub
code: install.packages('installr') installr::install.Rtools() ## install.packages('remotes') remotes::install_github("christophemetsu/theRmalUAV")

title: Clean and correct thermal UAV data
text: theRmalUAV requires several dependent packages, including fs, progress, rmarkdown, svDialogs, terra, tiff, others (see DESCRIPTION file complete list). Normally missing packages installed time, get error message missing package(s), install dependent packages separately (.e., ‘Packages’ pane RStudio) run remotes::install_github(“christophemetsu/theRmalUAV”, dependencies=FALSE).

title: Clean and correct thermal UAV data
text: read EXIF data image files, theRmalUAV requires external command line tool called ‘exiftool’. UPDATE: version 1.6.0, longer need manually install exiftool command line utility. Rather can install running: verify worked: Alternately, can install exiftool manually downloading http://www.sno.phy.queensu.ca/~phil/exiftool/. sure unzip folder path (e.g, c:) rename executable file exiftool(-k).exe exiftool.exe.
code: exiftoolr::install_exiftool() exiftoolr::exif_version() #> Using ExifTool version 12.50 #> [1] "12.50"

title: Clean and correct thermal UAV data
text: obtain table available thermal sensor can use, run T_uav_sensors() argument. sensor listed, may submit issue GitHub added. details see help page (?T_uav_sensor) contact package author.
code: T_uav_sensors()

title: Class
text: `Thermal.UAV-class` groups necessary information together logical order. object Class Thermal.UAV serves functions input provides data upon functions build. consists thermal classes, representing different kinds information.

title: Class
text: Info (S4 Thermal.Info) Holds general information regaring information image files project path, filenames, sensor info, meta data, time etc. Position (S4 Thermal.Position) Holds information position tifs including gps location, flightheight, overlap well shapefiles (`T_uav_pos_sensor()` run) Sharpness (S4 Thermal.Sharpness) Holds information sharpness used cleaning (e.g.: Sharpness threshold, cleaning methods, number images removed. etc.) Atmosphere (S4 Thermal.Atmosphere) Holds information atmospheric conditions flight including air temperature, relative humidity, atm. transmission, emissivity Smooth (S4 Thermal.Smooth) Holds information thermal smoothing correction : smooth length, method etc. Thermal.Data (list) list matrices holding thermal tiff files. Depending functions already run, represents raw corrected data.

title: Class
code: # Creates an empty Thermal.UAV class thermal_class <- methods::new("Thermal.UAV")

what: TheRmalUAV: Clean and correct thermal UAV data — TheRmalUAV-package
title: TheRmalUAV: Clean and correct thermal UAV data — TheRmalUAV-package
text: package designed correct thermal UAV data. comprises data cleaning, image reduction, caluclating overlap, atmospheric corrections, accounting temperature fluctuations flight, emissivity corrections ect. corrected data stored tiff-file updated exifdata, ready implement commercial structure motion softwares. furthermore provides opportunity optimize thermal camera positions using coregistrated high resolution cameras.

what: Keeps the best image per second — T_uav_clean_persec
title: Keeps the best image per second — T_uav_clean_persec
text: `T_uav_clean_persec()` ranks images within 1 second based sharpness keeps x sharpest images. function primarily streaming/filming thermal cameras like ThermalCapture. goal reduce number images processing.

title: Keeps the best image per second — T_uav_clean_persec
code: T_uav_clean_persec(thermal_uav, number_keep = 1, remove = FALSE)

title: Keeps the best image per second — T_uav_clean_persec
text: thermal_uav Thermal.UAV object retrieved previous functions (e.g.: `T_uav_info()`) number_keep (numerical) number images want keep per second (default = 1) remove (logical) use TRUE delete images local disk space, default FALSE images simple replaced subfolder called "Removed img_persec"

title: Keeps the best image per second — T_uav_clean_persec
text: updated Thermal.UAV object (re)moves least sharp images

what: Clean the dataset based on overlap or sharpness — T_uav_clean_reduc
title: Clean the dataset based on overlap or sharpness — T_uav_clean_reduc
text: `T_uav_clean_reduc()` reduces thermal dataset, either based sharpness minimal desired overlap. NOTE: extents yet calculated, function automatically calculate .

title: Clean the dataset based on overlap or sharpness — T_uav_clean_reduc
code: T_uav_clean_reduc(   thermal_uav,   method = "Overlap",   min_overlap = 0.8,   sharpness_threshold = 0.25,   remove = FALSE )

title: Clean the dataset based on overlap or sharpness — T_uav_clean_reduc
text: thermal_uav Thermal.UAV object retrieved previous functions (e.g.: `T_uav_info()`). Thermal.Data empty, raw TIFFs loaded directly folder containing tiff files. method method want choose image reduction. can "Overlap" reduce dataset based minimal overlap (final targetted overlap around `min_overlap`) "Sharpness" remove unsharp images (based `sharpness_threshold`). min_overlap (numerical) targetted overlap (0-1) "Overlap" method criteria acertain minimal overlap case large part consecutive unsharp images. Default 0.80 sharpness_threshold (numerical) threshold decide image sharp unsharp. Default 0.25 remove (logical) use TRUE delete images local disk space. Default FALSE images simple replaced subfolder called "Removed img_reduc"

title: Clean the dataset based on overlap or sharpness — T_uav_clean_reduc
text: function returns updated (reduced) Thermal.UAV object (re)moves least sharp images

title: Get sharpness threshold — T_uav_clean_thresh
text: `T_uav_clean_thresh()` estimates sharpness iteratively asking whether image sharp enough, sharp enough. goal set sharpness threshold used image reduction function.

title: Get sharpness threshold — T_uav_clean_thresh
code: T_uav_clean_thresh(thermal_uav)

title: Get sharpness threshold — T_uav_clean_thresh
text: thermal_uav Thermal.UAV object retrieved previous functions (e.g.: `T_uav_info()`). Thermal.Data empty, raw TIFFs loaded directly folder containing tiff files.

title: Get sharpness threshold — T_uav_clean_thresh
text: function returns sharpness value can set threshold `T_uav_clean_reduc()` function

title: Computes atmospheric corrections — T_uav_corr_atm
text: `TheRmalUAV::T_uav_corr_atm()` executes atmospheric corrections. Based amount input different corrections done. eqUAVtions estimate transmission Ts using background temperature based Heinemann et al. 2020 RS https://doi.org/10.3390/rs12071075

title: Computes atmospheric corrections — T_uav_corr_atm
code: T_uav_corr_atm(   thermal_uav,   flight_height = NA,   T_air = NA,   rel_hum = NA,   T_bg = 263.55,   emiss = 0.985 )

title: Computes atmospheric corrections — T_uav_corr_atm
text: thermal_uav Thermal.UAV object retrieved previous functions (e.g.: `TheRmalUAV::T_uav_info()`) flight_height (numerical) height SENSOR OBJECT INTEREST. Can single value vector length number images. specified search GPS altitude exif/meta data, use flight_height calculated `T_uav_sensor_pos` function T_air (numerical) air temperature °C flight. Can single value, vector length number images data.frame containing temperature data ("T_air") datetime ("datetime") UTC ("%d.%m.%Y %H:%M:%OS" format). provided mean temperature images taken rel_hum (numerical) relative humidity % flight. Can single value, vector length number images data.frame containing relative humidity data ("rel_hum") datetime ("datetime") UTC ("%d.%m.%Y %H:%M:%OS" format). provided value 50% assumed across entire flight. T_bg (numerical) background temperature Kelvin, temperature measured aluminium panel. emiss (numerical) emissivity, default average plats given (0.985)

title: Computes atmospheric corrections — T_uav_corr_atm
text: function returns updated Thermal.UAV object containing Thermal.Data atmospherically corrected

title: Corrects for emissivity — T_uav_corr_emis
text: `T_uav_corr_emis()` corrects stitched thermal orthomosaic emissivity, based high resolution landcover emissivity map.

title: Corrects for emissivity — T_uav_corr_emis
code: T_uav_corr_emis(   thermal_path,   thermal_uav,   temp = "K",   corrmap_path,   method = "LC",   write = FALSE,   filename = NA,   NDVI_veg = 0.8,   NDVI_soil = 0.2,   emiss_veg = 0.988,   emiss_soil = 0.935 )

title: Corrects for emissivity — T_uav_corr_emis
text: thermal_path path thermal map thermal_uav Thermal.UAV object corresponding thermal map. needed extract parameters used `T_uav_corr_atm()` temp indicate scale thermal map represents temperatures. Use "K" Kelvin "C" degree Celcius. corrmap_path path correction map. can either landcover map right labels NDVI map emissivity map method Indicate variable correction map provides. Use "LC" landcover provided, "NDVI" want us ethe NDVI method "EM" emissivity provided. write (logical) use TRUE corrected thermal map must written. Default = FALSE filename path filename corrected thermal map stored. NA, written thermal path label "_emis_corr". variable used `write` = TRUE NDVI_veg NDVI value vegetation. NDVI values threshold receive emissivity defined `emiss_veg` NDVI_soil NDVI value bare soil. NDVI values threshold receive emissivity defined `emiss_soil` emiss_veg emissivity vegetation, taken NDVI higher `NDVI_veg` emiss_soil emissivity bare soil, taken NDVI lower `NDVI_soil`

title: Corrects for emissivity — T_uav_corr_emis
text: returns recalculated thermal map corrected spatially varying different emissivities.

title: Smooths thermal data — T_uav_corr_smooth
text: `T_uav_corr_smooth()` smooths thermal dataset avoid large fluctuations. Two methods possible: () based provided high temporal resolution air temperature dataset (ii) empirical smoothing using temperatures images.

title: Smooths thermal data — T_uav_corr_smooth
code: T_uav_corr_smooth(   thermal_uav,   method = "image",   T_air = NA,   smooth_length = NA )

title: Smooths thermal data — T_uav_corr_smooth
text: thermal_uav Thermal.UAV object retrieved previous functions (e.g.: `T_uav_info()`). Note order smooth thermal data, T_uav_corr_atm ran first method One two methods: () "T_air" dataset smoothed based high resolution air temperature dataset (ii) "image" smoothing done based average image temperature, default "image" T_air method "T_air": air temperature °C flight. Can vector length number images data.frame containing temperature data ("T_air") datetime ("datetime") UTC ("%d.%m.%Y %H:%M:%OS" format). already provided `T_uav_corr_atm`, can leave black . Default NA smooth_length (numerical) amount images taken account smooth temperature. Default NA smooth length number overlapping images.

title: Smooths thermal data — T_uav_corr_smooth
text: function returns updated Thermal.UAV object smoothed Thermal.Data

what: Exports thermal data as tiff-files — T_uav_export
title: Exports thermal data as tiff-files — T_uav_export
text: `T_uav_export()` exports Thermal.Data. Note order export data, least T_uav_corr_atm ran first

title: Exports thermal data as tiff-files — T_uav_export
code: T_uav_export(thermal_uav, export_path = NA)

title: Exports thermal data as tiff-files — T_uav_export
text: thermal_uav Thermal.UAV object retrieved previous functions (e.g.: `T_uav_info()`). export_path path folder images stored. NA, images stored new folder original path called 'Ts'

title: Exports thermal data as tiff-files — T_uav_export
text: exports Thermal.Data tiff files. Note data stored centikelvin.

what: Gets all the necessary info — T_uav_info
title: Gets all the necessary info — T_uav_info
text: `T_uav_info()` gets information needed analysis

title: Gets all the necessary info — T_uav_info
code: T_uav_info(path, sensor = "ThermalCapture", meta_csv = NA, flight_height = NA)

title: Gets all the necessary info — T_uav_info
text: path path folder containing tiff files, path 1 tiff file sensor (character) Indicates sensor alias name given sensor.csv file meta_csv Patch ddditional meta data can provided form csv, provided info derived exif data (may limit function options) flight_height (numerical) height SENSOR GROUND. can single value vector length number images. specified search GPS altitude exif/meta data

title: Gets all the necessary info — T_uav_info
text: Thermal.UAV object necessary information, serves input following functions

what: Coregister locations with another camera — T_uav_pos_coreg
title: Coregister locations with another camera — T_uav_pos_coreg
text: `T_uav_pos_coreg()` corrects GPS-info thermal data accurate GPS information coregistered (high resolution) camera. also cameras coregistered sensor already aligned structure form motion software.

title: Coregister locations with another camera — T_uav_pos_coreg
code: T_uav_pos_coreg(   thermal_uav,   opt_cameras = NA,   rig_offset = c(0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0),   timediff = 0 )

title: Coregister locations with another camera — T_uav_pos_coreg
text: thermal_uav Thermal.UAV object retrieved previous functions (e.g.: `T_uav_info()`). opt_cameras (data.frame) containing optimized camera positions. right format, can prepared `T_uav_prep_coreg()` function rig_offset (numerical) vector containing different offsets thermal camera  compared reference optimized camera following offsets mm ° (x, y, z, yaw, pitch, roll). Default vector zeros timediff (numerical) time difference (seconds) optimized cameraset thermal data, can specified , default 0

title: Coregister locations with another camera — T_uav_pos_coreg
text: function returns updated Thermal.UAV object containing optimized thermal camera positions

what: Gets the information about the locations of the cameras — T_uav_pos_sensor
title: Gets the information about the locations of the cameras — T_uav_pos_sensor
text: `T_uav_pos_sensor()` gives location images option retrieve extents overlap. Furthermore, gives option export GPS/extent information

title: Gets the information about the locations of the cameras — T_uav_pos_sensor
code: T_uav_pos_sensor(thermal_uav, extent = FALSE, overlap = FALSE, export = FALSE)

title: Gets the information about the locations of the cameras — T_uav_pos_sensor
text: thermal_uav Thermal.UAV object retrieved previous functions (e.g.: `T_uav_info()`) extent (logical) use TRUE get extents instead GPS locations, default FALSE overlap (logical) use TRUE want calculate average overlap subsequent images (`extent` = TRUE), default FALSE export (logical) use TRUE want export GPS/extents shapefile image names attributes new folder "Shapefiles" within path folder, default FALSE

title: Gets the information about the locations of the cameras — T_uav_pos_sensor
text: updated Thermal.UAV object containing additional positional information

title: Shows the cameras/image extents on an interactive map — T_uav_pos_view
text: thermal_uav Thermal.UAV object retrieved previous functions (e.g.: `T_uav_info()`) extent (logical) use TRUE want plot image extents. NOTE: extents previously calculated `T_uav_pos_sensor()` function

title: Shows the cameras/image extents on an interactive map — T_uav_pos_view

title: Prepares data for coregistration — T_uav_prep_coreg
text: `T_uav_prep_coreg()` prepares data different sensor (higher GPS accuracy) use `T_uav_pos_coreg()` function.

title: Prepares data for coregistration — T_uav_prep_coreg
code: T_uav_prep_coreg(   img_path,   SfM_option = NA,   opt_camera_path = NA,   epsg = "4326",   sensor_name = "Altum-PT_MSP",   label = NA,   timezone = NA )

title: Prepares data for coregistration — T_uav_prep_coreg
text: img_path folder containing high resolution images SfM_option cameras first aligned SfM software options : "Agisoft Metashape", "Pix4DMapper". Use NA case want run without previous alignement. Default NA opt_camera_path path .txt .csv file optimized camera positions stored (SfM_option NA), defualt NA epsg epsg coordinates exported/stored, default "4326" (WGS 84, latitude/longitude coordinate system based Earth's center mass) sensor_name name high resolution sensor optimized GPS data used label needed multispectral data, subscript/sequence describing band/sensor everything calibrated (case Micasence Altum-PT panchromatic band: "_6"). label enter '' timezone timezone datetime data stored. Default NA preset use timezone computer system

title: Prepares data for coregistration — T_uav_prep_coreg
text: function returns data.frame containing positional information optimized cameras can used input `T_uav_pos_coreg()` function

NA report saved path original tifs project_name (character) name project put report flight_name (character) name flight put report pilot_name (character) name pilot put report location (character) location flight executed

text: exports Thermal.Data tif files
